wikipedia_page.main: Derek Graham Hawkins (18 May 1935 – 27 November 2010) was an English first-class cricketer. He was a right-handed batsman and a right-arm off-break bowler who played from 1952 to 1962 for Gloucestershire County Cricket Club. Hawkins was born at Alveston, Gloucestershire.Hawkins made 134 first-class appearances, scoring 3,755 runs @ 18.22 with a highest innings of 106, one of three centuries in addition to 17 half-centuries. He held 78 catches and took 38 wickets @ 30.34 with a best analysis of 6–81, the only occasion when he took five wickets in an innings.Hawkins died at Alveston on 27 November 2010.
